sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is distributive over intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the symmetric difference of the sets A and B, and then find the intersection of the sets A and B. Finally, find the symmetric difference of the intersection of A and B with the set A, and compare the result with the symmetric difference of the sets A and B. Verify that the symmetric difference of two sets is distributive over intersection.
